methods.name: setBoolean

parameters.name: viewId

methods.name: setChronometer
methods.summary: Sets the base time, format string, and started flag for a chronometer in the remote view hierarchy.
methods.description: See Android's documentation for [setChronometer](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/RemoteViews.html#setChronometer(int, long, java.lang.String, boolean)).

parameters.name: viewId
parameters.summary: Resource ID of the Chronometer to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using R.

parameters.name: base
parameters.summary: Time at which the timer would have read 0:00.

parameters.name: format
parameters.summary: Chronometer format string, or null to simply display the timer value.

parameters.name: started
parameters.summary: True if you want the clock to be started, false if not.

methods.description:
This method supports supports both Android and Titanium URLs.

See Android's documentation for [setImageViewUri](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/RemoteViews.html#setImageViewUri(int, android.net.Uri)).

parameters.name: uri

methods.summary: Sets the progress, max value, and indeterminate flag of a progress bar in the remote view hierarchy.
methods.description: See Android's documentation for [setProgressBar](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/RemoteViews.html#setProgressBar(int, int, int, boolean)).

parameters.name: viewId
parameters.summary: Resource ID of the progress bar to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using R.

parameters.name: max
parameters.summary: The new maximum value of the progress bar.

parameters.name: progress
parameters.summary: The new progress value of the progress bar (from 0..max).

parameters.name: indeterminate
parameters.summary: Determines whether the progress bar is indeterminate. If true, the progress bar displays an infinite looping animation.

properties.name: layoutId
properties.summary: Android layout resource ID for the view to display. Required.
properties.description:
To define a custom layout resource in your application, the XML layout file should be placed in platform/android/res/layout folder inside your project folder.

Use R to reference the ID of the layout.

properties.name: packageName
properties.summary: Package name that the resource ID lives in. Optional.
